set.name: SUPERBREAK® BACKPACK
set.description:
Take a peek at how the most iconic backpack is made. Inspired by the original JanSport daypack from 1967, the SuperBreak first hit stores in 1990. Now sold in 67 different countries, and designed in over 100 different colors and patterns, the SuperBreak is the most popular pack in the world. Explore the map to find out what goes into the [SuperBreak](http://www.jansport.com/shop/en/jansport-us/superbreak--t501).


DATA AS OF JULY 2018

FEATURES
Click the icons below to reveal unique features of our supply chain. Each element will highlight the facilities whose practices fall under one of the designated categories:

things.name: Thai Taffeta Co., Ltd.
things.address: No.13 Highway No.3191 Rd., Tambol Hueypong , Amphur Muangrayong, Rayong 21150 Thailand
things.description:
Number of Operators: 333
Total Number of Employees: 498
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 53% Male, 47% Female
Certifications: ISO 9001:2008; ISO 14001:2004; OEKO-TEX® Standard 100
Produced Here: S600D Polyester Fabric; 420D Nylon Pack Cloth

On average, more than 300k yards of recycled polyester are produced each month at this facility. Thai Taffeta's green initiatives include implementing a water treatment system to reduce heavy metals in waterways, recycling 100% of water used in weaving, and creating biomass energy from palm shell. Their plant is designed to absorb daylight and cut down energy usage during the day. Thai Taffeta offers free health check programs for all employees, and they have established an education fund program for children of select employees.

Thai Taffeta Co., Ltd. has been working with VF since 2007, with an annual production volume of around 10M yards.

#waterefficiency #energyefficiency #recycledmaterials
things.foot_note: All information has been verified by VF.

things.address: 3340 Chestney Road, Macon, Georgia 31217
things.description:
Number of Operators: 450
Total Number of Employees: 600
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): N/A
Certifications: STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX®; ISO 9001:2008; ISO 14001:2004; ISO/TS 16949:2009
Produced Here: Zippers; Hooks; Loops

YKK (U.S.A.) Inc. has onsite wastewater treatment, and a Trend System electronic resource monitor to improve energy efficiency. The zippers for this product are shipped from Taiwan to Macon, Georgia, where the zipper chain is dyed. The finished zippers are then shipped to VF's internal manufacturing plant in Nicaragua.

YKK (U.S.A.) Inc. began working with VF in the 1970's.

#energyefficiency #waterefficiency

things.name: Visalia DC
things.address: 2525 N Plaza Dr, Visalia, CA 93291, USA
things.description:
Number of Operators: 500
Total Number of Employees: 800
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 60% Male, 40% Female
Certifications: N/A
Brands Handled: Eagle Creek, Jansport, The North Face

Visalia Distribution Center is a VF owned facility, handling products exclusively for VF Outdoor brands. This distribution center has reduced its energy consumption by rolling out an LED light conversion plan and installing automatic on/off light switches throughout the facility. They have also installed a solar array to promote the use of renewable energy. Approximately 95% of the trash at this facility is recycled, with only the remaining 5% of food product sent to landfill. Visalia Distribution Center began operation in 2006 and handles 48M units annually.

#energyefficiency

things.name: Coats Honduras S.A.
things.address: Zona Libre Inhdelva, Edificio #13, 800m Carretera a la Jutosa, Choloma, Cortes, Honduras
things.description:
Number of Operators: 242
Total Number of Employees: 456
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 25% Male, 75% Female
Certifications: N/A
Produced Here: Thread

Coats joined ZDHC (Zero Discharge of Harmful Chemicals) in May 2016. Their senior management group has representatives from 46 different nationalities, and over 40% of their gloabl workforce is women. Their Restricted Substances List (RSL) incorporates the requirements of all major environmental standards.

In 2016, Coats Honduras S.A. reduced the amount of energy used in their manufacturing by 4%. Since 2013, they have reduced the proportion of raw materials that end up as waste by 22%. In 2015, their local managers developed over 120 community engagement plans in nearly 50 different countries. They reduced GHG emissions by 11% per kilo of dyed product in 2016, and in 2017, their carbon footprint was down 7% from the previous year. Their EcoVerde ranges of industrial threads and zips are made from recycled polyester, and they have reduced water usage by more than 12% since 2013.

Coats Honduras S.A. has been working with VF since 2007.

#community #waterefficiency #energyefficiency #recycledmaterials
things.foot_note: Information provided by supplier, not verified by VF.

Produced Here: 600D Polyester Fabric

Yaw Liamy Enterprise Co., Ltd. is a vertically integrated weaving, dyeing, printing, and laminating factory. The materials for this Jansport product are manufactured by their their textile processor, Summitex. Their environmental sustainability measures include the use of use of recycled polyester, EPM (YL Color Palette), and a water-based foam coating. They have also installed solar panels and a renew cooling water recycled system, which recycles water in the evaluation stage.

Yaw Liamy Enterprise Co., Ltd. has been working with VF since 2004.

#chemicalreduction #energyefficiency #waterefficiency

Certifications: N/A
Produced Here: Backpacks

Horizon Outdoor (Cambodia) Co. Ltd. produces 80% of the assortment of this product. They are fully powered by solar energy and the production facilities are all equipped with a water curtain coolant system, which provides a comfortable working temperature and environment for their employees. All employees are protected by the NSSF (National Welfare Insurance). Employee benefits include food allowance, transportation, bottled drinking water, and maternity leave.

Horizon Outdoor (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been working with VF since 2013, with an annual business volume of around 3.9M pieces for bags, and 1.1M pieces for outerwear.

#chemIQ #energyefficiency #3rdwayvendor

things.name: VF Jeanswear Nicaragua & Cia. Ltda.
things.address: Km. 14.1 Carretera Norte, 650 Mts. Al Sur, Parque Industrial ZIPSA, Managua, Nicaragua
things.description:

Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio):
Managua Plant: 63% Male, 37% Female
San Marcos Plant: 55% Male, 45% Female
Certifications: Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production (WRAP)
Produced Here: VF Products

VF Jeanswear Nicaragua & Cia. Ltda. participates in community service activities for VF Day each year. In 2016, they worked in a school for children with disabilities to paint classrooms, repair a water tank, and rebuild a playground. In 2017, they worked with two schools in different communities to paint, fence perimeters, and build water canals.

This factory has been in operation since 2007, with a capacity of 2M yards for pants, and an annual production volume of 26k dozen backpacks.
